member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidAction.LaunchAppWhenTapped
member.summary: Default is false

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidAlarmType.Rtc
member.summary: Alarm time in System.currentTimeMillis() (wall clock time in UTC). This alarm does not wake the device up; if it goes off while the device is asleep, it will not be delivered until the next time the device wakes up.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidAlarmType.RtcWakeup
member.summary: Alarm time in System.currentTimeMillis() (wall clock time in UTC), which will wake up the device when it goes off.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidAlarmType.ElapsedRealtime
member.summary: Alarm time in SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() (time since boot, including sleep). This alarm does not wake the device up; if it goes off while the device is asleep, it will not be delivered until the next time the device wakes up.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidAlarmType.ElapsedRealtimeWakeup
member.summary: Alarm time in SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() (time since boot, including sleep), which will wake up the device when it goes off.

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidColor
member.summary: the notification icon and application name will have the provided ARGB color

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidColor.Argb
member.summary: if set, will ignore ResourceName

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidGeofenceOptions.ExpirationDurationInMilliseconds
member.summary: Sets the expiration duration of geofence. This geofence will be removed automatically after this period of time. Time for this proximity alert, in milliseconds, or -1 to indicate no expiration. When positive, this geofence will be removed automatically after this amount of time.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidGeofenceOptions.LoiteringDelayMilliseconds
member.summary: If loitering delay is set the geofence service will send a alert roughly after user enters a geofence if the user stays inside the geofence during this period of time. If the user exits from the geofence in this amount of time, alert won't be sent. The delay for confirming dwelling, in milliseconds

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidGeofenceOptions.ResponsivenessMilliseconds
member.summary: Sets the best-effort notification responsiveness of the geofence. Defaults to 0. Setting a big responsiveness value, for example 5 minutes, can save power significantly. However, setting a very small responsiveness value, for example 5 seconds, doesn't necessarily mean you will get notified right after the user enters a geofence: internally, the geofence might adjust the responsiveness value to save power when needed. (milliseconds) defines the best-effort description of how soon should the callback be called when the transition associated with the Geofence is triggered. For instance, if set to 300000 milliseconds the callback will be called 5 minutes within entering or exiting the geofence.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidIcon.DefaultType
member.summary: Default Group Name

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidIcon.ResourceName
member.summary: The name of the desired resource

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidIcon.Type
member.summary: Optional default resource type to find, if "type/" is not included in the name. Can be null to require an explicit type.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.Unspecified
member.summary: Value signifying that the user has not expressed an importance. This value is for persisting preferences, and should never be associated with an actual notification.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.None
member.summary: Does not show in the shade

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.Min
member.summary: Only shows in the shade, below the fold. This should not be used with Service.startForeground since a foreground service is supposed to be something the user cares about so it does not make semantic sense to mark its notification as minimum importance. If you do this as of Android version Build.VERSION_CODES.O (26), the system will show a higher-priority notification about your app running in the background.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.Low
member.summary: Shows in the shade, and potentially in the status bar, but is not audibly intrusive.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.Default
member.summary: Shows everywhere, makes noise, but does not visually intrude

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.High
member.summary: Shows everywhere, makes noise and peeks. May use full screen intents

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidImportance.Max
member.summary: Unused

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidLaunch
member.summary: Launch the App instead of posting the notification to the status bar. Only for use with extremely high-priority notifications demanding the user's immediate attention, such as an incoming phone call or alarm clock that the user has explicitly set to a particular time. If this facility is used for something else, please give the user an option to turn it off and use a normal notification, as this can be extremely disruptive. The system UI may choose to display a heads-up notification, instead of launching this app, while the user is using the device. Apps targeting Android Q 10 (29) and above will have to request a permission (Manifest.permission.USE_FULL_SCREEN_INTENT) in order to use full screen intents. To be launched, the notification must also be posted to a channel with importance level set to IMPORTANCE_HIGH or higher.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidLaunch.InHighPriority
member.summary: Passing true will cause this notification to be sent even if other notifications are suppressed. the default is true.

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions
member.summary: NotificationRequest for Android

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.DefaultChannelId
member.summary: Default Channel Id.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.DefaultChannelName
member.summary: Default Channel Name

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.DefaultGroupId
member.summary: Default Group Id

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.DefaultGroupName
member.summary: Default Group Name

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.AutoCancel
member.summary: Setting this flag will make it so the notification is automatically canceled when the user clicks it in the panel. Default is true

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.ChannelId
member.summary: Sets or gets, The id of the channel. Must be unique per package. The value may be truncated if it is too lon Use this to target the Notification Channel.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.Color
member.summary: If set, the notification icon and application name will have the provided ARGB color.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.IconLargeName
member.summary: if Set, find the icon by name from drawable and set it has the Large Icon to use in the notification layouts. if not set, application Icon will we used.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.IconSmallName
member.summary: if Set, find the icon by name from drawable and set it has the Small Icon to use in the notification layouts. if not set, application Icon will we used.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.IsGroupSummary
member.summary: Set this notification to be the group summary for a group of notifications. Grouped notifications may display in a cluster or stack on devices which support such rendering

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.LaunchApp
member.summary: Launch the App instead of posting the notification to the status bar. Only for use with extremely high-priority notifications demanding the user's immediate attention, such as an incoming phone call or alarm clock that the user has explicitly set to a particular time. If this facility is used for something else, please give the user an option to turn it off and use a normal notification, as this can be extremely disruptive. The system UI may choose to display a heads-up notification, instead of launching this app, while the user is using the device. Apps targeting Android Q 10 (29) and above will have to request a permission (Manifest.permission.USE_FULL_SCREEN_INTENT) in order to use full screen intents. To be launched, the notification must also be posted to a channel with importance level set to IMPORTANCE_HIGH or higher.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.LaunchAppWhenTapped
member.summary: Default is true

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.LedColor
member.summary: If set, the LED will have the provided ARGB color.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.Ongoing
member.summary: Set whether this is an ongoing notification. Ongoing notifications differ from regular notifications in the following ways, Ongoing notifications are sorted above the regular notifications in the notification panel. Ongoing notifications do not have an 'X' close button, and are not affected by the "Clear all" button. Default is false

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.Priority
member.summary: Set the relative priority for this notification. In Android, Only used if Android Api below 26. Use NotificationCenter.CreateNotificationChannel when Android Api equal or above 26

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.ProgressBar
member.summary: Set the progress this notification represents. The platform template will represent this using a ProgressBar.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.TimeoutAfter
member.summary: Specifies the time at which this notification should be canceled, if it is not already canceled.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.VibrationPattern
member.summary:
Vibrate with a given pattern. Pass in an array of int`s that are the durations for which to turn on or off the vibrator in milliseconds. The first value indicates the number of milliseconds to wait before turning the vibrator on. The next value indicates the number of milliseconds for which to keep the vibrator on before turning it off. Subsequent values alternate between durations in milliseconds to turn the vibrator off or to turn the vibrator on.
This method was deprecated in API level 26. use NotificationChannel

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.VisibilityType
member.summary: Sphere of visibility of this notification, which affects how and when the SystemUI reveals the notification's presence and contents in untrusted situations (namely, on the secure lockscreen).

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidOptions.When
member.summary: DateTime set with When is shown in the content view.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPendingIntentFlags.CancelCurrent
member.summary: Flag indicating that if the described PendingIntent already exists, the current one should be canceled before generating a new one. You can use this to retrieve a new PendingIntent when you are only changing the extra data in the Intent; by canceling the previous pending intent, this ensures that only entities given the new data will be able to launch it. If this assurance is not an issue, consider

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPendingIntentFlags.Immutable
member.summary: Flag indicating that the created PendingIntent should be immutable. This means that the additional intent argument passed to the send methods to fill in unpopulated properties of this intent will be ignored.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPendingIntentFlags.NoCreate
member.summary: Flag indicating that if the described PendingIntent does not already exist, then simply return null instead of creating it.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPendingIntentFlags.OneShot
member.summary: Flag indicating that this PendingIntent can be used only once.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPendingIntentFlags.UpdateCurrent
member.summary: Flag indicating that if the described PendingIntent already exists, then keep it but replace its extra data with what is in this new Intent. This can be used if you are creating intents where only the extras change, and don't care that any entities that received your previous PendingIntent will be able to launch it with your new extras even if they are not explicitly given to it.

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPriority
member.summary: Set the relative priority for this notification. Priority is an indication of how much of the user's valuable attention should be consumed by this notification. Low-priority notifications may be hidden from the user in certain situations, while the user might be interrupted for a higher-priority notification. The system sets a notification's priority based on various factors including the setPriority value. The effect may differ slightly on different platforms.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPriority.Min
member.summary: Lowest notification priority, these items might not be shown to the user except under special circumstances, such as detailed notification logs.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPriority.Low
member.summary: Lower notification priority, for items that are less important. The UI may choose to show these items smaller, or at a different position in the list, compared with your app's Default items.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPriority.Default
member.summary: If your application does not prioritize its own notifications, use this value for all notifications.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPriority.High
member.summary: Higher notification priority, for more important notifications or alerts. The UI may choose to show these items larger, or at a different position in notification lists, compared with your app's Default items.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidPriority.Max
member.summary: Highest notification priority, for your application's most important items that require the user's prompt attention or input.

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidProgressBar
member.summary: Set the progress this notification represents. The platform template will represent this using a ProgressBar.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidProgressBar.IsIndeterminate
member.summary: Set whether this progress bar is in indeterminate mode

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidProgressBar.Max
member.summary: Set Upper limit of this progress bar's range

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidProgressBar.Progress
member.summary: Set progress bar's current level of progress

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidScheduleOptions
member.summary: NotificationRequestSchedule for Android

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidScheduleOptions.AlarmType
member.summary: Default is RtcWakeup

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidScheduleOptions.AllowedDelay
member.summary: In Android, do not Schedule or show notification if NotifyTime is earlier than DateTime.Now and this time delay. Default is 1 min

member.name: M:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidScheduleOptions.GetNextNotifyTimeForRepeat(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},Plugin.LocalNotification.NotificationRepeat,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: internal use, only for Android

member.name: M:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidScheduleOptions.GetNotifyRepeatInterval(Plugin.LocalNotification.NotificationRepeat,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: internal use, only for Android

member.name: M:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidScheduleOptions.IsValidNotifyTime(System.DateTime,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: To be consistent with iOS, Do not show notification if NotifyTime is earlier than (DateTime.Now - AllowedDelay)

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidVisibilityType
member.summary: Sphere of visibility of this notification, which affects how and when the SystemUI reveals the notification's presence and contents in untrusted situations (namely, on the secure lockscreen).

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidVisibilityType.Private
member.summary: The default level, behaves exactly as notifications have always done on Android: The notification's icon and tickerText (if available) are shown in all situations, but the contents are only available if the device is unlocked for the appropriate user.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidVisibilityType.Public
F:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.AndroidVisibilityType.Secret
member.summary: Will suppress its icon and ticker until the user has bypassed the lockscreen

member.name: M:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.IAndroidLocalNotificationBuilder.AddChannel(Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest)
member.summary: A representation of settings that apply to a collection of similarly themed notifications. Create Notification Channel when API >= 26.

member.name: M:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.IAndroidLocalNotificationBuilder.AddChannelGroup(Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelGroupRequest)
member.summary: A grouping of related notification channels. e.g., channels that all belong to a single account. Create Notification Channel Group when API >= 26. If you'd like to further organize the appearance of your channels in the settings UI, you can create channel groups. This is a good idea when your app supports multiple user accounts (such as for work profiles), so you can create a notification channel group for each account. This way, users can easily identify and control multiple notification channels that have identical names.

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelGroupRequest
member.summary: A grouping of related notification channels

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelGroupRequest.Group
member.summary: The id of the group. Must be unique per package. the value may be truncated if it is too long

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelGroupRequest.Name
member.summary: The user visible name of the group, The recommended maximum length is 40 characters; the value may be truncated if it is too long.

member.summary: Constructor to pass values directly

member.summary: Sets or gets, the user visible name of this channel, default is General.

member.summary: Sound file name for the notification.

member.summary: Sets or gets, Sets whether notification posted to this channel should play sound.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest.VibrationPattern
member.summary: Only modifiable before the channel is submitted.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest.LockScreenVisibility
member.summary: Sets or gets, whether or not notifications posted to this channel are shown on the lock Screen in full or redacted form.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest.ShowBadge
member.summary: Sets or gets, Sets whether notifications posted to this channel can appear as application icon badges in a Launcher.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest.EnableLights
member.summary: Sets or gets, Sets whether notifications posted to this channel should display notification lights, on devices that support that feature.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest.EnableVibration
member.summary: Sets or gets, Sets whether notification posted to this channel should vibrate. The vibration pattern can be set with VibrationPattern

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.AndroidOption.NotificationChannelRequest.CanBypassDnd
member.summary: Sets or gets, Sets whether notification posted to this channel can bypass DND (Do Not Disturb) mode.

member.name: T:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions
member.summary: NotificationRequest for iOS

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.HideForegroundAlert
member.summary: Setting this flag will prevent iOS from displaying the default banner when a Notification is received in foreground Default is false

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.PlayForegroundSound
member.summary: Setting this flag will enable iOS to play the default notification sound even if the app is in foreground Default is true

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.PresentAsBanner
member.summary: Setting this flag will enable iOS to Present the notification as a banner Default is true

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.ShowInNotificationCenter
member.summary: Setting this flag will enable iOS to Show the notification in Notification Center Default is true

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.ApplyBadgeValue
member.summary: Setting this flag will enable iOS to Apply the notification's badge value to the app’s icon Default is true

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.Priority
member.summary: The Priority determines the degree of Priority associated with the notification. Default is active

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.RelevanceScore
member.summary: The system uses the relevanceScore, a value between 0 and 1, to sort the notifications from your app. The highest score gets featured in the notification summary.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.SummaryArgument
member.summary: The string the notification adds to the category’s summary format string.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSOptions.SummaryArgumentCount
member.summary: The number of items the notification adds to the category’s summary format string.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSPriority.Passive
member.summary: The system adds the notification to the notification list without lighting up the screen or playing a sound.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSPriority.Active
member.summary: The system presents the notification immediately, lights up the screen, and can play a sound. (default)

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSPriority.TimeSensitive
member.summary: The system presents the notification immediately, lights up the screen, and can play a sound, but won’t break through system notification controls.

member.name: F:Plugin.LocalNotification.iOSOption.iOSPriority.Critical
member.summary: The system presents the notification immediately, lights up the screen, and bypasses the mute switch to play a sound.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.NotificationRequest.NotificationId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the request (if identifier is not unique, a new notification request object is not created). You can use this identifier later to cancel a request that is still pending.

member.summary: Returning data when tapped or received notification.

member.summary: Schedule notification (cannot be mixed with geofence)

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.NotificationRequest.Geofence
member.summary: Set the location aware geofence (cannot be mixed with schedule)

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.NotificationRequest.Silent
member.summary: Silences this instance of the notification, regardless of the sounds or vibrations set on the notification or notification channel.

member.name: P:Plugin.LocalNotification.NotificationRequest.Sound
member.summary: Sound file name for the notification. In Android, Only used if Android Api below 26. Use NotificationCenter.CreateNotificationChannel when Android Api equal or above 26

member.summary: Subtitle for the notification.
